articles.title: TxDOT San Angelo Begins $40 Million Widening of Old Christoval Rd. Monday
articles.excerpt: According to TxDot San Angelo, the project will include widening the roadway from the current two lanes to four lanes with a turning lane.
articles.summary: The LIVE! Daily is the "newspaper to your email" for San Angelo. Each content-packed edition has weather, the popular Top of the Email opinion and rumor mill column, news around the state of Texas, news around west Texas, the latest news stories from San Angelo LIVE!, events, and the most recent obituaries. The bottom of the email contains the most recent rants and comments. The LIVE! daily is emailed 5 days per week. On Sundays, subscribers receive the West Texas Real Estate LIVE! email.

articles.title: Amazon is rolling out a generative AI feature that summarizes product reviews
articles.author: Haleluya Hadero
articles.excerpt: Amazon is rolling out a generative AI feature that summarizes product reviews for customers. The company said in a blog post Monday that it will use AI to pick out
articles.summary: This image provided by shows Amazon shows the new generative AI product review feature. Amazon is rolling out a generative AI feature that summarizes product reviews for customers. The company said in a blog post Monday, Aug. 14, 2023, that it will use AI to pick out common themes in reviews and summarize them in a short paragraph on the product detail page.

articles.title: Can prevented planting be improved? Farmers from three states weigh in
articles.author: ting
articles.excerpt: In 2022, there were a total of 4 million prevented planting acres in North Dakota, South Dakota and Minnesota, according to the U.S. Agriculture Department Farm Service Agency
articles.summary:
FARGO — A prevented planting listening session drew about a hundred farmers and crop insurance agents from North Dakota, South Dakota and Minnesota to Fargo to voice their suggestions about how coverage of the Federal Crop Insurance provision could be improved.

The listening session in Fargo had one of the largest turnouts of the hearings held so far, Risk Management Agency staff said. That's not surprising, because the three states, just in the past few years, have had millions of acres of prevented planting.
articles.authors: Abailey Agweek.Com Or Phone At,Ann Bailey,ting

articles.title: Californians are fleeing to Texas, where homes and the cost of living are cheaper
articles.author: Alcynna Lloyd
articles.excerpt: Californians are packing up and moving to Texas, census data shows, where some are finding it easier to buy a home in the Lone Star State.
articles.summary:
In the face of rising costs, many 
Californians have headed east
 in search of a bigger slice of the American dream  —  and found it in the sprawling fields of the Lone Star state.
In fact, the path from California to Texas has emerged as a popular interstate relocation route in the US. In 2021, almost 108,000, people 
migrated from California to Texas
, according to an analysis of the most recent 
Census data
.
The saying is that everything is "bigger" in Texas but, for Californians, is it also cheaper?
Rogelio Saenz, a professor of demography at the University of Texas at San Antonio, told 
USA Today
 that in terms of affordability, the answer is a resounding yes.

articles.title: Funny Horror Movie Moments That Were Supposed To Be Serious
articles.author: Damion Damaske
articles.excerpt: Sometimes horror movies don't quite hit the mark, and they have moments that end up more funny than scary.
articles.summary:
Funny Horror Movie Moments That Were Supposed To Be Serious

Horror is a genre defined by themes of terror, existentialism, and dread. Oftentimes to be successful, horror films need to do more than just simply entertain an audience — they also have to find a way to make that audience feel real fear, despite their innate knowledge that they are watching the terror unfold in the safety of a movie theater or their own home. Nonetheless, the best horror films are able to break that barrier and make their imaginary threats feel visceral to the viewers.

articles.title: AFC Women's Champions League To Begin In 2024-2025 Season
articles.author: Manasi Pathak
articles.excerpt: The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) announced that the AFC Women's Champions League will kick off in the 2024-25 season, starting off as an invitational tournament.
articles.summary:
The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) announced on Monday that the AFC Women's Champions League will kick off in the 2024-25 season, starting off as an invitational tournament.

The introduction of the AFC Women's Champions League follows the two pilot AFC Women's Club Championship, which was organized by the governing body in 2021 and 2022. Its third edition is due to be held later this year.

The current AFC Women's Club Championship champions are Thailand's College of Asian Scholars in the East Zone and Uzbekistan's Sogdiana Jizzakh in the West Zone.

articles.title: Generative AI's Dark Side: How It's The Perfect Tool For Hackers To Spread Malware
articles.author: Christian Espinosa
articles.excerpt: How can companies avoid being the target of a generative AI attack?
articles.summary:
CEO at Blue Goat Cyber. Veteran. Heavy Metal lover. Author of "The Smartest Person in the Room." 24x Ironman Finisher. Blood clot survivor.

Generative AI presents many opportunities for businesses to improve operations and reduce costs. On the bright side, there is great potential for this form of AI to deliver value to organizations. However, it has a dark side in the cybersecurity landscape, as hackers can easily manipulate it to spread malware.

How can companies avoid being the target of a generative AI attack? It's not an easy, simple answer.

articles.title: What Is WCAG? (And How To Comply)
articles.author: Ran Ronen
articles.excerpt: Accessibility is an ongoing commitment.
articles.summary:
Founder and CEO of Equally AI, a world-class, secured, convenient and modern web accessibility compliance solution for everyone.

If you're new to web accessibility, you may have heard of "WCAG," or the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines. But understanding all the technical terms and how they affect you and your business can be a bit overwhelming.

While WCAG forms the basis for web accessibility laws, there may be additional criteria you need to meet to achieve compliance in your country. Navigating these requirements can be complex and ever-changing, but even a small amount of WCAG knowledge can make a big difference.

articles.title: How musicians can make money on Twitch
articles.author: Alana Bonilla On In
articles.excerpt: The popular live-streaming app, Twitch, may not seem like the first choice for music marketing, but plenty of features can even make musicians a profit. Keep reading to learn more…. Continue reading
articles.summary:
The popular live-streaming app, Twitch, may not seem like the first choice for music marketing, but plenty of features can even make musicians a profit. Keep reading to learn more…
by 
Janelle Borg
 from 
Amplify You
In this digital age, musicians have a wide range of platforms at their disposal to 
promote their music 
and engage with fans. One such platform is Twitch. Unlike other social media platforms, Twitch empowers artists to build a community of fans who are really interested in different facets of the artist's career.

articles.title: ‘The Witcher' Producer Says Geralt Is On The Level Of Batman, Superman And James Bond
articles.author: Paul Tassi
articles.excerpt: Producer Tomek Baginski gave an interview with Polish outlet Wyborcza where of course, he was asked about Henry Cavill leaving The Witcher
articles.summary:
If you were wondering about why The Witcher has gone downhill since season 1, even with Henry Cavill still on board, it may be because at least a few of the higher-ups attached to the project may be a bit…delusional.

Producer Tomek Bagiński gave an interview with Polish outlet Wyborcza where of course, he was asked about Henry Cavill leaving The Witcher. Once again, he talks about how different actors play different pop culture icons over time, but this time he's saying that The Witcher has reached some new threshold:

'I am most pleased that the series was created and became so popular,' he said.

articles.title: 10 Best Live Service Games to Play
articles.author: Diana D'Estefano
articles.excerpt: In this article, we will talk about some of the best live service games you should play if you love this type of games.
articles.summary: In recent years, live service games have become increasingly popular among the gaming community. If they didn't arouse very positive reactions at the beginning (to be honest, there are still many players who don't look kindly on this genre of games), over time they have increasingly managed to make room among the hierarchies of video games and climb more and more positions. Nowadays, some of the most played games internationally are live services and it is for this reason that we have decided to create this article in which we show you 10 of the best live service games to play.

articles.title: Peyton Manning returning to Tennessee as professor
articles.author: Chris Low
articles.excerpt: Peyton Manning was a star both on and off the field at the University of Tennessee, and now he's returning to his alma mater as a professor.
articles.summary:
KNOXVILLE, Tenn. -- Peyton Manning was a star both on and off the field at the University of Tennessee, and now he's returning to his alma mater as a professor.

The university announced Monday that the College of Communication and Information has appointed Manning as a professor of practice in the Fall 2023 term. The Pro Football Hall of Fame quarterback will join select classes during the academic year as a featured expert and work alongside the college's faculty to provide learning experiences for CCI students at Tennessee.
articles.authors: Adam Rittenberg,Andrea Adelson,Blake Baumgartner,Chris Low,David Hale,Espn Betting Insiders,Espn Senior Writer,Pete Thamel,Tom Vanhaaren

articles.title: Long-time owners sell Third Drop Coffee; Fargo shop will become Moonrise Cafe
articles.author: Tammy Swift Hails A Family
articles.excerpt: New owners of Broadway store envision a place which offers homemade soups and sandwiches with locally sourced ingredients, good, strong coffee and European-inspired pastries.
articles.summary:
FARGO — Alexa Eugeno pushes open the front door to the soon-to-be Moonrise Cafe at 111 Broadway and welcomes visitors inside the space, which is darkened by the paper now covering the tall front windows.
'Please excuse the mess,' she says with a bashful smile, weaving through slightly askew tables and chairs, which are strewn with oversized, foliage-filled vases, wall hangings and other remnants from the shop's former life as Third Drop Coffee.
Then again, she and business partner Emily Driscoll only took ownership Aug.

articles.title: Messi's Magic Continues as Inter Miami Prepares for Leagues Cup Semi-final, Philadelphia Union Coach Warns Team Against Complacency
articles.author: Business Times
articles.excerpt: Lionel Messi, the football superstar, has been making waves since his recent move to Inter Miami, not just for his unparalleled skills on the field but also for the attention he's drawing off it. As…
articles.summary:
Lionel Messi dismissed the rumors of him leaving Barcelona in January but the team captain said he is ready to depart at the end of the season and join a new club. (Photo: REUTERS/Juan Medina/File Photo)
 
 
 
 
 
Lionel Messi, the football superstar, has been making waves since his recent move to Inter Miami, not just for his unparalleled skills on the field but also for the attention he's drawing off it. As Inter Miami prepares for their Leagues Cup semi-final clash against Philadelphia Union, the latter's coach, Jim Curtin, has issued a subtle warning, emphasizing that while Messi might be the "greatest player in the history of the sport," his team won't be intimidated.

articles.title: Austin startup funding: Osano, One Model, Flueid snag VC
A United Airlines pilot on vacation in Hawaii volunteered to fly a plane from Maui to mainland US to help 300 people escape the fire
articles.author: Joshua Zitser
articles.excerpt: A United Airlines pilot on vacation who witnessed the devastating Maui wildfires in Hawaii volunteered to fly some 300 people back to the mainland US.
articles.summary:
A United Airlines pilot volunteered to help about 300 people escape Maui's 
raging wildfires
, working during his vacation to pilot a plane out, 
according to CBS Colorado.
Vince Eckelkamp was on vacation in Hawaii with his family and was scheduled to fly out on Tuesday, around the time the wildfires began, the news outlet said.
As his family traveled from their hotel to Kahului Airport on Maui, they witnessed the devastation the fires engulfing parts of the island were causing.
"It was crazy, there were powerlines down, trees down, couple people walking, and they were getting pelted with sand and debris and roof shingles, it was like we were in a vortex," his wife, Kathy Eckelkamp, said in an interview with CBS Colorado.

articles.title: Is Amgen Stock Fully Valued After A 17% Rise In A Month?
articles.author: Trefis Team
articles.excerpt: Amgen stock (NASDAQ: AMGN) has seen a 17% rise in a month, outperforming the broader S&P500 index, up 1%.
articles.summary: Amgen stock (NASDAQ NDAQ: AMGN) has seen a 17% rise in a month, outperforming the broader S&P500 index, up 1%. The recent rise can be attributed to its upbeat Q2 results. The company reported revenues of $7.0 billion, up 6% y-o-y, faring better than the consensus estimate of $6.7 billion. Also, its bottom line of $5.00 on a per share and adjusted basis was comfortably above the $4.46 consensus estimate. Adjusted operating margin contracted about 50 bps to 52.6% in the quarter, partly due to higher R&D costs.

articles.title: Pinellas County beach guide: Where to eat, drink and relax along the Gulf
articles.author: Gabrielle Calise
articles.excerpt: Our top picks at 10 local beaches, from salty dive bars to dreamy getaways.
articles.summary:
tampabay.com/newsletters.

It's no secret that Pinellas County beaches are considered some of the most pristine in the country. But with so much great sandy real estate, figuring out which beach to visit can be tricky. Add in busy holiday weekends, throngs of tourists and hourlong traffic jams and it can be easy to write off a beach day completely. Still, all it takes to have a successful trip is a little planning.

We're sharing 10 of our favorite beach spots, starting at Honeymoon Island in north Pinellas and ending at Fort De Soto at the southern end of the county.
articles.authors: Dining Critic,Gabrielle Calise,Helen Freund,Helen Freund Is The Food,Nostalgia,Tampa Bay Times,Times Staff,ter Who Covers Music,ting On

articles.title: Babylist Opens Its First Brick And Mortar Showroom In Beverly Hills
articles.author: Sharon Edelson
articles.excerpt: Babylist is primed to make its mark on the $88 billion baby market with the opening of its first brick and mortar showroom in Beverly Hills.
articles.summary:
Babylist is primed to make its mark on the $88 billion baby market with the opening of an 18,000-square-foot brick and mortar showroom in Beverly Hills. 'Because we actively engage with our community on a daily basis, we understand their brand preferences and how they evolve,' said Natalie Gordon, founder and CEO. 'As a result, we help partners make an impact on their target audience.'

The 12-year-old digital destination for growing families, today announced the opening of Babylist Beverly Hills, a flagship showroom experience that underscores the company's leadership in the baby market.

articles.title: Fred Meyer says anti-theft measures in Portland stores have shown results
articles.author: Kristine de Leon
articles.excerpt: In June, Fred Meyer announced a partnership with the city to combat crimes and theft at Portland stores.
articles.summary:
Fred Meyer
 officials say tougher security measures at its Portland stores appear to be having noticeable results in reducing theft.
Todd Kammeyer, the regional Kroger Co. subsidiary's president, told The Oregonian/OregonLive the number of products retrieved by store security have gone down by 80% after new anti-theft measures, like receipt checks at exits and having more security guards in stores, were put in place. He said it's too early to measure the difference in inventory lost to theft but that the company thinks the decline in recovery rates reflects fewer items going out the door unpaid.
articles.authors: Kdeleon Oregonian.Com,Kristine De Leon,The Oregonian Oregonlive,The Oregonian/OregonLive,kristinedeleon

articles.author: Hugh McIntyre

articles.summary:
Last week, Jason Aldean reigned over the Hot 100 charts with his single "Try That in a Small Town." This country tune seized the coveted top spot from Jung Kook and Latto, emerging victorious after a closely-fought race the week prior. Yet, as the dust settles, it becomes evident that the song's initial surge of success was short-lived, underscoring the fleeting nature of outrage-driven popularity.

In its third week gracing the Hot 100, "Try That in a Small Town" experienced a dramatic descent from its No.

articles.title: When Work Isn't Perfect: Three Suggestions For Getting Out Of A Rut
articles.author: Josée Larocque Patton
articles.excerpt: Many of us spend more time at work than at home, so do what you can to ensure you love your organization, the people and your job.
articles.summary:
CEO & Founder at THE HR ICU. Providing simple, affordable and time-efficient HR tools for all levels of people leaders in an organization.

Everyone has times when they love their job and career and other days when they don't want to get out of bed. Yet, has it not been said many times over that we spend more time at work than we do at home, so it is important to love what you do? This is easier said than done. There are so many variables that can affect our happiness at work, including our immediate boss, our colleagues and even the image our organization has within our community or country.

articles.title: This Chef Went From Homeless To Millionaire Restaurateur In Less Than 3 Years
articles.author: Amber Love Bond

articles.summary:

In 2013, he started Chef Baul Catering, a high-end catering company that specialized in southern, Caribbean, and Asian cuisine. His flavorful recipes and excitable spirit quickly made him a sought after name in the music industry as he scored opportunities to cook for chart-topping artists including Cardi B.

articles.title: What Is A Website Builder? All You Need To Know
articles.author: Johanna Leggatt
articles.excerpt: What Is A Website Builder? All You Need To Know
articles.summary:
A website builder allows you to create a website without coding experience. It's a convenient solution for freelancers, small business owners or anyone who wants to put up a website quickly without investing too much time or money. These use a drag-and-drop interface that is intuitive to use and offers plenty of flexibility and customisation. This article explains what website builders are, what they are best suited for and what features they provide.

Crack the Code

There are two different types of website builders: online and offline.

articles.title: Where to Stay in Miami in 2023 (Best Places And Areas)
articles.author: Theplanetd Team
articles.excerpt: Looking to book accommodation in Miami? Make sure to read our guide on where to stay including the best areas and places in Miami as well as insider tips and more.
articles.summary:
Miami needs little introduction. The mixture of art deco architecture, swaying palm trees, and some of the best beaches in the US make it a world-famous destination. There are so many things to do in Miami. Where you choose to stay can massively dictate – and support or hinder – your Miami itinerary. Will you stay amidst art deco architecture in South Beach? Or in one of the all-inclusive Florida resorts on quieter Key Biscayne? Where to stay in Miami is a tough call.



This guide will tackle the question of where to stay in Miami head-on.

articles.title: Massachusetts ranked best state in America to live in
articles.author: Natalie Khait
articles.excerpt: Massachusetts is the best state in America to live in, according to a new report.
articles.summary:
Mass — Massachusetts is the best state in America to live in, according to a new report.
In compiling its report on 
2023′s Best States to Live in
, the personal-finance website WalletHub says it compared the 50 states across 51 key indicators of livability, including housing costs, income growth, education rate, and quality of hospitals.
Massachusetts was crowned the top state to live in, followed by New Jersey, New Hampshire, New York, and Wyoming. 
The living conditions in Massachusetts ranked as follows, according to the report:
8th
 – % of Population in Poverty
13th
 – Income Growth
1st
 – % of Insured Population
2nd
 – % of Adults in Fair or Poor Health
5th
 – Avg.

articles.summary:
Wall Street inched toward small gains before the opening bell ahead of a raft of data this week that may provide more insight into the health of U.S. retailers.
Futures for the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average ticked up a little more than 0.1% Monday.
The government on Tuesday will release its retail sales report for July, while Home Depot, Target, TJX Cos. and Walmart will post their most recent quarterly results this week.
Retail spending has been a bit bumpy
 through the first half of the year after surging nearly 3% in January.

articles.title: Why Did Cathie Wood Sell Tesla Stock
articles.author: Q.ai
articles.excerpt: High-profile investors like Cathie Wood tend to make headlines if they're buying or selling - and this year, Wood has only sold Tesla shares.
articles.summary:
Key takeaways

ARK Invest sold around 76,000 Tesla shares last week
Tesla's share price has been declining since the Q2 earrings report
The company has the upcoming Cybertruck release and China sales cuts up its sleeve

High-profile investors like Cathie Wood tend to make headlines if they're buying or selling - and this year, Wood has only sold Tesla shares. After her company ARK Invest sold off more shares last week, having already made more sales just before Tesla's Q2 earning beat, others are now wondering if the shares have peaked for the year.

articles.title: The latest on the probe into Trump's efforts to overturn 2020 election in Georgia
articles.author: Aditi Sangal
articles.excerpt: Fulton County, Georgia, District Attorney Fani Willis is expected to seek more than a dozen indictments as part of her investigation into efforts by Donald Trump and his allies to overturn the 2020 presidential election results in the state. Follow here for the latest live news updates.
articles.summary:
It's been eight years since he rode down the escalator in Trump Tower and more than two years since the January 6, 2021, insurrection, but the legal drama surrounding Donald Trump has never been more intense.

The former president has already been indicted three times this year, and a potential indictment looms in Georgia.

Fulton County, Georgia, District Attorney Fani Willis oversaw a special grand jury investigating what Trump or his allies may have done in their efforts to overturn Biden's victory in the state.

articles.title: Hayden Christensen Is Doing A Great ‘Clone Wars Voice' For ‘Ahsoka' In New Trailer
articles.author: Paul Tassi
articles.excerpt: Christensen seems to be paying direct homage to the much-praised performance of Matt Lanter, who voiced Anakin in Clone Wars,
articles.summary:
Anakin
Disney


I was pretty bummed that Hayden Christensen barely got to do anything in Obi-Wan, short of a flashback and walking around in the Vader armor. Now, that appears to be changing to some degree for Ahsoka. No, I doubt he'll be a major player, given how far into the future (and after his death) the show is set, but the latest 
trailer 
shows that he will be a part of the series, and probably already has more lines than he did in Obi-Wan.
 
What's interesting, however, is that Christensen seems to be paying direct homage to the much-praised performance of Matt Lanter, who voiced Anakin in Clone Wars, and is credited with giving a lot more dimension to the character than George Lucas's prequel trilogy allowed.

articles.title: Nearly 1500 academics mobilize against Israeli "apartheid" in the Palestinian territories
articles.author: Anonym
articles.excerpt: Nearly 1500 academics mobilize against Israeli "apartheid" in the Palestinian territories. Authors of open letter to Jewish institutions in North America equate situation with an apartheid regime. Israeli forces have killed more than 190 Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza since the beginning of the year and demolished more than 590 structures. The authors of the letter call for limiting the use of US military aid in the occupied Palestinian territories and for an end to what they call Israel's impunity within international organizations. The signatories recall that Palestinians are deprived of almost all basic rights, including the right to vote and protest.
articles.summary:
Nearly 1500 academics mobilize against Israeli "apartheid" in the Palestinian territories

Highlights: Nearly 1500 academics mobilize against Israeli "apartheid" in the Palestinian territories. Authors of open letter to Jewish institutions in North America equate situation with an apartheid regime. Israeli forces have killed more than 190 Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza since the beginning of the year and demolished more than 590 structures. The authors of the letter call for limiting the use of US military aid in the occupied Palestinian territories and for an end to what they call Israel's impunity within international organizations.

articles.title: Switching car insurance saved me hundreds of dollars a year, and now I review my policy every 6 months
articles.author: Jackie Lam
articles.excerpt: I spent awhile sticking to the same car insurance provider, but I decided to take another look, and now I'm going to review my insurance regularly.
articles.summary:
Our experts answer readers' insurance questions and write unbiased product reviews (
here's how we assess insurance products
). In some cases, we receive a commission from 
our partners
; however, our opinions are our own.
During the pandemic, I switched from my regular insurance policy to Metromile. Being in quarantine with nowhere to go meant that switching from a standard car insurance policy to a pay-per-mile one saved me hundreds each year in insurance.
Fast forward to today, and I drive a lot more.

articles.title: The New Paradigm Of Generative AI
articles.author: Manoj Chaudhary
articles.excerpt: Although there are potential risks linked to the use of large language models and generative AI, businesses shouldn't be afraid to explore their capabilities.
articles.summary:
Manoj Chaudhary is the CTO and SVP of Jitterbit.

AI technology has existed for decades, but building applications using it to solve business problems has always been challenging and expensive. Before OpenAI entered the scene, there were key challenges that needed to be addressed before starting to build applications using AI:

1. Acquiring in-house AI expertise

2. Identifying and training the models

3. Obtaining the right datasets to train the models

4. Building the necessary infrastructure for training

These are costly and time-consuming.

articles.title: City buys Denver motel for housing, 27 months after saying it would
articles.author: Thomas Gounley

articles.summary:
The seller of the former Stay Inn at 12033 E. 38th Ave. in Denver bought it with plans to reopen it as a Travelodge. 
(Eric Lutzens/The Denver Post)


A city plan to buy a northeast Denver motel to use as housing finally came to fruition on Friday.


The former Stay Inn at 12033 E. 38th Ave. changed hands in the morning when paperwork was signed on a deal 
originally announced in May 2021
.


On the 6th day of that month, Congresswoman Diana Degette and then-Mayor Michael Hancock held a press conference to announce the city would be buying the property, in part with federal funds.

articles.title: Farm Progress America, August 14, 2023
articles.excerpt: Mike Pearson examines the WASDE report released last week that shows a smaller corn and soybean crop.
articles.summary:
Mike Pearson talks about the World Agriculture Supply and Demand Estimates (WASDE) report released by the USDA Friday.
The markets waited anxiously to see how the USDA would adjust the yields of corn, soybeans and wheat due to the wild weather this growing season.
Traders expected a decline in production and the report showed just that.
The report shows an expected two bushel drop in corn production and one bushel drop in soybeans.
The USDA report shows 175.1 bushels of corn per acre-- down from July and 50.

Kunio Hara is the creator of the renowned HO-ME-I-KU Method, an effective employee and executive education program for achieving success.

Customer satisfaction is crucial to a company. Low prices and high-quality services attract consumers. Michael Porter, an American management scholar, has also advocated management strategies to beat competitors and establish a competitive advantage in one's industry. Indeed, if a company loses in the market competition, it will be forced to withdraw. "How do we win?" This is an essential question in business.

articles.title: Island tripping: An unusual development restriction limits one pocket of Denver
articles.author: Thomas Gounley
articles.excerpt: Downtown Denver looms in the background as a truck rumbles north in Fox Island, a 185-acre neighborhood surrounded by interstates and railroad tracks. (Thomas Gounley/BusinessDen)</
articles.summary:
Downtown Denver looms in the background as a truck rumbles north in Fox Island, a 185-acre neighborhood surrounded by interstates and railroad tracks. 
(Thomas Gounley/BusinessDen)


Editor's note:
 This is the first half of a two-part series.


They call it Fox Island.


It's a 185-acre pocket of Denver, technically part of Globeville, surrounded not by water but by transportation corridors — Interstate 70 to the north, Interstate 25 to the east and south, and railroad tracks to the west.


Fox Street is the one main road that traverses it.

articles.title: Pence 'not going to engage in negative personal attacks' with Trump
articles.excerpt: ABC News (NEW YORK) — Former Vice President Mike Pence said in a new interview with ABC News that he's not interested in trading insults with former President Donald Trump, who has been criticizing…
articles.summary:
ABC News


(NEW YORK) — Former Vice President Mike Pence said in a new interview with ABC News that he's not interested in trading insults with former President Donald Trump, who has been criticizing Pence online and on the campaign trail — especially in the wake of Trump's latest indictment.


In a sit-down in Ankeny, Iowa, ABC News Live Prime anchor Linsey Davis pointed to one recent social media post from Trump that accused Pence of going to the 'dark side.'


'How do you respond to that?' Davis asked in a clip from the interview, which will air on Monday night.

articles.title: For Mark Zuckerberg's Threads, the real rival is still TikTok -- not the former Twitter
articles.author: BARBARA ORTUTAY
articles.excerpt: Threads, the simple, bare-bones text-based social network created by Facebook owner Meta, burst onto the scene during a particularly bad week for the rival then still known as Twitter.
articles.summary:
Threads, the simple, bare-bones text-based social network created by Facebook owner Meta, burst onto the scene during a particularly bad week for the rival then still known as Twitter. It quickly amassed 100 million signups — a huge feat for a newcomer in the space — and was dubbed as a 'Twitter killer.'

By week two, though, signups began to drop off. As of Aug. 7, the number of people who used Threads daily hovered around 10 million on Android phones, down from 49 million when it launched a month earlier, according to research firm SimilarWeb.

.

articles.title: Struggling property developer Country Garden's shares hit record low after suspending bond trading amid a severe cash crunch
articles.author: Joseph Wilkins
articles.excerpt: Country Garden Holdings – once China's largest developer by sales – announced in a weekend release that it would suspend trading in ten of its bonds.
articles.summary:
China's property sector has been dealt with another blow as shares in one of its largest developers hit an all-time low Monday morning, after it suspended trading in almost a dozen local bonds. 
Country Garden Holdings – once China's largest developer by sales – announced in a weekend release that it would be suspending trading in ten of its yuan-denominated bonds 
after missing two coupon payments worth a combined $22.5 million last week
. The move adds to speculation that the firm will begin restructuring its debt with the help of financial advisers.

articles.title: Was ‘Secret Invasion' Purposefully Designed To Be Ignored By ‘The Marvels'?
articles.author: Paul Tassi
articles.excerpt: I think that Secret Invasion was designed to be ignored by The Marvels entirely. That if you missed Secret Invasion, as millions upon millions of Marvel movie-watchers have, you could just remember Fury got on a ship a while ago and is…still on the ship,
articles.summary:
Secret Invasion, one of Marvel's worst MCU projects to date (at least by viewership, review scores, actual uh, quality) focused on Skrulls and their infiltration of the US. The plot was odd from the start, as in the comics, it was all about Skrulls replacing superheroes, not just normal humans and world leaders, but I found its ending the strangest part of all.

In it, Samuel L. Jackson's Nick Fury, having just arrived back on earth from his many years away on board a spaceship, just…returns to that spaceship at the end.

articles.title: Niger Coup: Junta Leaders Will Charge Ousted President With ‘High Treason'
articles.author: Robert Hart
articles.excerpt: If found guilty, democratically elected President Mohamed Bazoum could face the death penalty.
articles.summary:
Topline

Niger's military junta announced plans to charge ousted President Mohamed Bazoum with 'high treason' and undermining national security, defying international pressure to release and reinstate the democratically elected leader and raising tensions in the region just hours after coup leaders signaled they were open to explore diplomatic solutions to the growing crisis.

In a statement delivered on state television Sunday night, junta spokesman Colonel Major Amadou Abdramane vowed to prosecute Bazoum 'for high treason and for undermining the internal and external security of Niger.

articles.title: A throng of interfaith leaders to focus on combating authoritarianism at global gathering in Chicago
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.excerpt: Thousands of people representing scores of religions and belief systems are expected to convene in Chicago for a weeklong event.
articles.summary:
More than 6,000 people representing scores of religions and belief systems are expected to convene in Chicago starting Monday for what organizers bill as the world's largest gathering of interfaith leaders.

For the Parliament of the World's Religions, the week-long event marks a return to its roots – the organization was founded in Chicago in 1893. In the past 30 years, it has convened six times, most recently in Toronto in 2018.

Past gatherings have drawn participants from more than 80 nations.

articles.title: Combo of Dish and EchoStar could have IFEC implications
articles.author: Mary Kirby
articles.excerpt: A decision by Dish Network and EchoStar to combine operations in an all-stock merger may in time have implications for IFEC.
articles.summary:
A decision by Dish Network Corporation and EchoStar Corporation 
to combine operations in an all-stock merger
 may in time have implications for inflight entertainment and connectivity. After all American television provider Dish already supplies inflight live TV to the airline market, whilst EchoStar subsidiary Hughes Network Systems is now a OneWeb distribution partner in aero and, together with its JUPITER Ka-band satellites and partner satellites, can supply capacity for onboard Internet as well as 
serve the market directly with its own new IFC solutions
 and services.

articles.summary: (RTTNews) - Eli Lilly and Co. (LLY) a biopharmaceutical company, announced on Friday that it has completed the acquisition of Sigilon Therapeutics, Inc. (SGTX).

articles.title: Neymar, World's Most Expensive Soccer Star, Signs For Saudi Team
articles.author: Marie Schulte-Bockum
articles.excerpt: Neymar Jr., the Brazil international and PSG forward, is currently undergoing his medical exam for a transfer to the Saudi Arabian club Al-Hilal, multiple sources report.
articles.summary:
Neymar Jr., who previously moved from Barcelona to Paris Saint-Germain for a record transfer fee of €222 million ($243 million), is about to join Al-Hilal, the record champions of the Saudi Pro League.

The Brazil international is currently undergoing his medical exam, per multiple sources. According to CBS Sports, Al-Hilal will pay PSG a transfer fee of €90 million ($98 million) for the 31-year-old, whose contract with the Parisians was set to expire in 2025. Neymar will sign a two-year contract will Al-Hilal, earning him an annual salary of €200 million ($219 million), CBS Sports reported.

articles.title: Huntsville police officer awarded lifesaving medal
articles.author: Josiah Elmore
articles.excerpt: A Huntsville Police officer has been awarded a lifesaving medal for his role in tending to a shooting victim in February.
articles.summary:
HUNTSVILLE, Ala. (WHNT) — A Huntsville police officer has been awarded a lifesaving medal for his role in tending to a shooting victim in February.

In February, officers responded to shooting call at a hotel on North Memorial Parkway. Taylor Grenier was one of those officers who responded and took immediate action.

Officer Grenier tended to the victim who had been shot by applying a tourniquet to the victim's right leg and applying pressure to stop the bleeding until HEMSI could arrive, according to the Huntsville Police Department (HPD).

articles.title: The daily business briefing: August 14, 2023
articles.author: Harold Maass
articles.excerpt: U.S. Steel's board rejects an unsolicited offer from rival Cleveland-Cliffs, Democrats target "junk fees," and more
articles.summary:
Skip to header
Skip to main content
Skip to footer
U.S. Steel has rejected an unsolicited offer from rival Cleveland-Cliffs that valued U.S. Steel at more than $7 billion, The Wall Street Journal reported Sunday. Cleveland-Cliffs called the rejection of its bid by U.S. Steel's board "unreasonable." Cleveland-Cliffs had offered $17.50 a share plus 1.023 shares of its stock, with an implied value of $35 a share, marking a significant premium over U.S. Steel's $22.72 closing price on Friday. U.S. Steel said it would continue to go over "strategic alternatives.

articles.title: Judge Rebukes UFC In Antitrust Class Certification Order, Leaves Openings For Appeal
articles.author: Paul Gift
articles.excerpt: The lifeless antitrust case against the world's largest MMA promoter was finally revived last week. Here are the important takeaways.
articles.summary:
After five-and-a-half long years, the judge overseeing the antitrust lawsuit against the UFC finally released his order granting class certification status to the plaintiff fighters seeking up to $1.6 billion in damages.

Last Wednesday, U.S. District Judge Richard Boulware of Las Vegas, NV certified a 'bout class' of over 1,200 fighters who fought for the promotion between December 16, 2010 and June 30, 2017 with claims the UFC anticompetitively foreclosed rival MMA promoters and suppressed fighter pay through the use of long-term exclusive contracts, coercive conduct, and the elimination or acquisition of competitors.

articles.title: CIS welcomes three new cardiologists to the Bayou Region
articles.excerpt: Cardiovascular Institute of the South (CIS) is welcoming three new cardiologists to its clinics in the Bayou region: Drs. Ayush Arora, McCall Walker, and Paritosh Kafle.
articles.summary:
Cardiovascular Institute of the South (CIS) is welcoming three new cardiologists to its clinics in the Bayou region: Drs. Ayush Arora, McCall Walker, and Paritosh Kafle.
 


Dr. Ayush Arora is an interventional cardiologist joining the CIS team at the Thibodaux clinic. He completed an internal medicine residency at Rutgers New Jersey Medical School in Newark, New Jersey. His cardiology fellowship was completed at the University of Texas Medical School in Houston, Texas, and his fellowship in interventional cardiology was completed at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York.

articles.title: The Dawn Of Humanoid Robotics: A Glimpse Into The Future
articles.author: Aswin Sarang
articles.excerpt: Looking ahead, the healthcare industry presents a promising avenue for the application of humanoid robots.
articles.summary:
CEO at Reliable Robotics.

The world of robotics has been evolving at an unprecedented pace, with humanoid robots at the forefront of this technological revolution. These robots, designed to mimic human form and behavior, are transforming various sectors, from healthcare and education to entertainment and personal assistance.

In this article, I'll delve into the latest innovations in humanoid robotics, the market dynamics in this space and the future prospects of this burgeoning field.

Innovations In Humanoid Robotics

Several pioneering companies have been making significant strides in the field of humanoid robotics.

articles.title: Prediction: These 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Growth Stocks Will Join ...
articles.author: Danny Vena
articles.excerpt: Artificial intelligence has changed the technology landscape, and these two companies should profit from that revolution.
articles.summary:
One of the biggest trends to emerge in the stock market over the past couple of decades has been the increasing dominance of technology stocks. Roughly 20 years ago, General Electric and ExxonMobil were the world's largest companies in terms of market capitalization -- worth $319 billion and $283 billion, respectively.

A review of the current list of chart toppers reveals just how much things have changed. Technology titans Apple and Microsoft lead the list, with market caps of $2.8 trillion and $2.

articles.title: How To Cultivate Your Employees' Artificial Intelligence Skillset
articles.author: Samir Wagle

articles.summary:
Founder of 11:11 Partners, a firm that helps create leadership teams at the intersection of their skill set and passion.

A March estimate by Goldman Sachs predicted that 300 million jobs could be replaced by generative artificial intelligence. Meanwhile, IBM has announced plans to stop hiring people for jobs it thinks AI can do. The Washington Post reported on professionals whose jobs were replaced by AI and became air conditioning technicians and dog walkers as a result.

As the CEO of a company, I'm supporting my employees as they learn to master the technology themselves.

articles.title: 10 Ways Video Content Can Drive Diverse Talent Recruitment
articles.author: Expert Panel®
articles.excerpt: We share the company's external and internal achievements, especially as it promotes diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging.
articles.summary:

articles.title: 15 Creative Strategies To Generate Positive Business Publicity On A Budget
articles.author: Expert Panel®
articles.excerpt: While having a large budget can be a big help in generating positive press, there are ways to do the same with fewer resources.
articles.summary: The role of marketing in propelling a new venture to success cannot be understated. While entrepreneurs are frequently reminded of the pivotal role marketing plays in their business strategy, the question of managing tight budgets often looms large. Striking a balance between garnering effective publicity and maintaining cost efficiency can be a daunting challenge. This delicate equilibrium, however, can be achieved through innovative yet economical approaches that spark favorable press mentions and generate buzz around a budding business.
articles.authors: Council Post,Expert Panel,Expert Panel®,Forbes Councils Member

articles.title: Goldman Sachs' CEO is stuck; can he survive?
articles.author: Rob Copeland
articles.excerpt: David Solomon under pressure amid partner exodus and stalled share price
articles.summary:
One day in mid-June, Lloyd Blankfein called David Solomon, chief executive of Goldman Sachs. Mr Solomon had not been expecting it.
Mr Blankfein, a big Goldman shareholder and Mr Solomon's predecessor, had lost $50 million (€45 million) since January on his stake because of the bank's sinking stock. He made it clear to Mr Solomon that his patience was waning, according to three people briefed on the conversation. Mr Blankfein offered to provide him with more hands-on advice, or even return to the firm in any capacity that might help, the people said.

articles.title: Little Tikes Launches the Story Dream Machine™ in Partnership with Random House Children's Books Aimed at Encouraging Early Literacy
articles.author: Mga Entertainment
articles.excerpt: All-New Innovative and Portable Projector Brings Storytime to Life for Children Ages 3-6 through Classic Story Collections Like Little Golden Books...
articles.summary:
NEW YORK, LOS ANGELES and HUDSON, OHIO, Aug. 14, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- 
The Little Tikes Company
, the brand trusted by parents and loved by kids for nearly 55 years, and a wholly-owned subsidiary of 
MGA Entertainment
, Inc.
 
(MGA), one of the world's largest and fastest growing privately held toy and entertainment companies, today announced the launch of the 
Little Tikes® Story Dream Machine™
. This all-new innovative portable projector is not only an engaging toy but is also an early reading tool and sleep solution.

articles.title: NeuroBo Pharmaceuticals names Hyung Heon Kim as CEO
articles.author: Pranav Ghumatkar
articles.excerpt: NeuroBo Pharmaceuticals (NRBO) has announced the appointment of current Board member, Hyung Heon Kim, as the Co.'s CEO and President, effective immediately..Mr
articles.summary:
NeuroBo Pharmaceuticals (
NASDAQ:
NRBO
) has 
announced
 the appointment of current Board member, Hyung Heon Kim, as the Co.'s CEO and President, effective immediately..


Mr. Kim succeeds Joseph Hooker, who served as interim CEO and President since January 2023.
 
Prior to his appointment as CEO and President, Mr. Kim served as the General Counsel and a Senior VP of Dong-A ST Co.

articles.title: Commissioner Wins Secure Energy Appeal: Key Takeaways
articles.author: Acquiremedia
articles.excerpt:
The Federal Court of Appeal's recent decision1 upholding the Commissioner of Competition's largely successful challenge of Secure Energy Services Inc.'s acquisition of Tervita Corporation provides...
 -Today at 08:12 am- MarketScreener
articles.summary: The Federal Court of Appeal's recent decision1 upholding the Commissioner of Competition's largely successful challenge of Secure Energy Services Inc.'s acquisition of Tervita Corporation provides further evidence that the Commissioner can succeed in challenging mergers even when efficiencies are raised as a defence, despite oft-stated concerns about the defence. It has now been almost ten years since the courts have saved an anti-competitive merger on the basis of the efficiencies defence (whichdecisionwas reached on the narrowest of technical grounds).

articles.title: The UAW vs The Big Three: why the union's contract demands 'aren't going to happen'
articles.author: Pras Subramanian
articles.excerpt: In an hour-long address recently about the state of the UAW vs. Big 3 contract talks, UAW president Shawn Fain took off the gloves. The bottom line: after all the sacrifices the UAW had made over the years, the days of rolling over were done. The bill is due.
articles.summary:
UAW president Shawn Fain raised some eyebrows recently, during a Facebook Live video address to the union faithful.
In an hour long talk, Fain, a 20-year UAW veteran and a former shop chair at Stellantis' Kokomo Indiana plant, told members what he had planned for the Big 3 (GM (GM), Ford (F), and Stellantis (STLA), formerly Chrysler), for this year's contract negotiations. The bottom line: after all the sacrifices the UAW had made over the years, the days of rolling over were done. The bill is due.

articles.title: Bitcoin Depot GAAP EPS of -$0.69, revenue of $197.5M; reaffirms FY23 guidance
articles.author: Meghavi Singh
articles.excerpt: Bitcoin Depot press release (BTM): Q2 GAAP EPS of -$0.69.Revenue of $197.5M (+17.7% Y/Y).Adjusted EBITDA, a non-GAAP measure, in the second quarter of 2023 was $19.8 million, up 54%...
articles.summary:
Bitcoin Depot 
press release
 (
NASDAQ:
BTM
): Q2 GAAP EPS of -$0.69.
 
Revenue of $197.5M (+17.7% Y/Y).
 
Adjusted EBITDA, a non-GAAP measure, in the second quarter of 2023 was $19.8 million, up 54% from the second quarter of 2022. Adjusted EBITDA margin in the second quarter of 2023
 was 10% compared to 8% in the second quarter of 2022. 
 
Reiterates Full Year 2023 Guidance for Revenue and Adjusted EBITDA. 
Based on current market conditions, Bitcoin Depot expects consolidated revenue in 2023 to range between $700 million and $730 million, an 8% to 13% improvement compared to $647 million in 2022.

articles.title: Nashville Soccer Club Advances to the Semifinals in Leagues Cup ...
articles.author: Michael Carpenter
articles.excerpt: Williamson Source is your portal to all things news, sports, lifestyle and events in Franklin, Brentwood, Spring Hill, Cool Springs, Nolensville and Fairview, TN.
articles.summary:
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (Aug. 11, 2023) – Nashville Soccer Club advanced to the Leagues Cup 2023 semifinals after drubbing Minnesota United 5-0 playing up a man since the 34th minute. Shaq Moore, Teal Bunbury, Alex Muyl, Sam Surridge and Hany Mukhtar drove the scoring for the Boys in Gold tonight as Elliot Panicco records the club's first shutout in the tournament.

Nashville SC will face the winner of the LAFC against CF Monterrey match taking place at 9:30 p.m. CT tonight. Nashville SC would host Monterrey on Tuesday, Aug.
